ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about studies that pointed toward the effectiveness of different policies to aid in development in low GDP countries.
Learned more about economic development in low-income countries
I developed a better understanding of developmental economics
Knowledge and Effects of experiments / policies to improve social and economic welfare in developing countries
A broad introduction to various case studies on economic development

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is good at exposing students to a wide variety of studies and interventions that help develop countries and offer an idea of what types of policies actually work for economic development and those that are ineffective and reasons why. Students learn to read economics papers. However, the lecture slides can be improved by explicitly stating the relevant results from each study.

The content was very interesting and the Professor was extremely knowledgeable. However, sometimes the data got too granular. Maybe incorporating a discussion session during the second half of the class or biweekly so we could debate the issues amongst our peers could be hugely beneficial or more intellectually stimulating.
This is a great course and I learned a lot

S: once a week, presentation of paper was interesting 
W: not super engaged in first half

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to students who are interested in economic policy and foreign aid because it teaches about the efficacy of such interventions. I would not recommend it to someone who wants an engaging course that is challenging.
I would. Great senior seminar Econ class
Yes! Interesting and low workload course with a professor who wants you to do well
